Japan, despite producing a ton of this kind of porn, is still FAR behind western countries on abuse rates to the point of irrelevance. Saying it isn't reported is a common factor for abuse globally, so congrats for stating the bleeding obvious.
Actual pedophiles aren't reading Loli doujins, they're grooming kids and trying to market their lifestyle as 'normal' under the veneer of LGBT and other groups. Many sexual violence victims in Japan do not report assaults to police: https://mainichi.jp/english/articles/20201123/p2a/00m/0na/024000c

I have sources below to support my claims here. Assult of children in Japan is rapidly raising every year. This is from one of the sources ''over 80% of respondents who claimed they were sexually abused via insertion of bodily organs by parents, parents' partners, or relatives, were aged 12 or younger''. The whole culture in Japan is extremely toxic. Another section from one of the sources ''Just 10.9% of all respondents consulted experts or support groups over the abuse, and only 15.1% contacted police. Furthermore, victim reports were accepted by police for only 7% of all respondents, while merely 0.7% reported that their attackers were indicted and found guilty in lawsuits.'' Loli hentai just helps out with this. I would HIGLY advise you to look at the images and sources I have linked.

Any kind of sexualisation of children normalizes it in real life. People may say that fapping to lolies is a way for pedos to went their sexual frustration instead of real children. Which is true, however the thruth is that more people are actually getting into lolies/shotas through anime, hentai etc. This will eventually, in some cases, lead to real life children. People say ''As long as you are jerking it off to cartoons and not real children you are okay'', number of children getting raped in Japan is rising every year, in America it's decreasing. Remember, the age of consent in Japan is extremely low.

Any country that imprisons someone for seeing or possessing a drawing of any kind can only be inhabited and governed by bugs disguised as humans (Australia is redundant).

If you want my **personal opinion** on the matter; again, take it at your own risk and with a grain of salt:

> They're drawings. It's fiction. People butcher individuals and cause genocide in games like Skyrim, GTA and/or whatever game exists out there.

So by that reasoning, if games don't make people murderers and everything that happens inside the game remains a fictive activity, then by the same logic, (and we're not even going to talk about lolicon at this point) but any normal porn that involves rape, public indecency, abuse, lolicon, underage, whatever [**staged of course**] should be legal.

But alas, we live in an ignorant world. People get triggered easily. Especially ignorants that run governments.

Don't get me wrong. I love lolicon genre as much as everyone here. I am not trying to intimidate any one of you, nor cause a war. But I do like to state the facts as they truly are and to make people aware. By all means, if you have something to prove me wrong, please do so, as I too want to see such proof. Law often has been and will be somewhat irrational, especially when it comes to taboo topics.

Anyone who's actually a lawyer here who has some serious knowledge about how law/court works on this matter?

Another reason might be simply because most people who visit the sites that actually do provide loli might have it legal in their nation and has the server hosted there. And of course, there's the simple reason that most people view this stuff in private and/or don't bring it in the public, which of course, would very likely, land you in prison, and not necessarily because of the law I discussed earlier. But also because of public indecency. It is illegal to have porn material displayed in public.

Long Story - 

Some governments have encountered this case before and have learned from mistakes, while others haven't.

A few governments have clearly identified the difference between pornography involving ACTUAL children versus fiction. And as such, updated the law accordingly. Japan for example and Brazil, among a few others.

The others instead, choose to go by a "bit of a stupendous" approach, likely because of ignorance or lack of care. Instead of actually giving a fuck, they encompass the entire legislation to pretty much "ban" any sort of material related. (note - "virtual pornography is illegal; strict laws".)

These nations are serious about making it illegal and will arrest you if they find such material in your possession.

So why is loli easily available on the internet and not most people have been arrested? Well, honestly I don't know.
It could be because some people actually believe the law itself to be flawed as it is a "victimless" crime. At end of day, its a drawing

@HakaSaki00 - Actually, let me clear up some myths. You are using rationality to answer your own  doubts. That's fine. I do agree with your statements. However, sad fact of the matter is - it actually is illegal. And I will point you to actual references that does mention this.

Of course, if I am wrong, feel free to correct me. Also, all information below may or may not be accurate. Consider at your own risk.

---

Short story

It's legal in some places, such as some US States, Canada, Sweden, Scotland and Brazil. At least, according to this: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legal_status_of_fictional_pornography_depicting_minors

It is illegal pretty much everwhere else. Norway, Ireland, some US States, The UK, Russia, Australia, etc.

Note, that most nations clearly specify the following: "covered images whether or not they are realistic."

Check your own juristriction and read that wiki page. If in doubt, visit your own nation's constitution.
